claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.

combined_evidence.quote: Flublok contains recombinant HA proteins of the three strains of influenza virus specified by health authorities for inclusion in the annual seasonal vaccine.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that Flublok uses the exact strains specified by health authorities (such as WHO and FDA) for the annual flu vaccine, supporting the claim that it ensures an identical antigenic match.

combined_evidence.quote: Flublok is standardized according to United States Public Health Service (USPHS) requirements. For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains: A/West Virginia/30/2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm09-like virus) (H1N1), A/Massachusetts/18/2022 (H3N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote provides the exact strains included in Flublok for the 2024-2025 season, demonstrating that the vaccine's composition matches the strains selected by public health authorities, which are based on WHO and FDA recommendations.

combined_evidence.quote: Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography. The purified HAs are then blended and filled into single dose syringes.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote describes the manufacturing process, indicating that the hemagglutinin antigens are produced to match the selected strains, supporting the claim of an identical antigenic match.

combined_evidence.quote: Flublok [Influenza Vaccine] is a sterile, clear, colorless injection containing recombinant hemagglutinin (HA) proteins from three influenza viruses for intramuscular use. It contains purified HA proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived from Sf9 cells of the fall armyworm, Spodoptera frugiperda (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butterflies), and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically defined lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts. Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography. The purified HAs are then blended and filled into single dose syringes.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote describes the manufacturing process of Flublok, emphasizing that the vaccine contains purified recombinant HA proteins from three specific influenza viruses, supporting the claim that Flublok ensures an identical antigenic match to the selected strains.

combined_evidence.quote: Flublok contains recombinant HA proteins of the three strains of influenza virus specified by health authorities for inclusion in the annual seasonal vaccine. These proteins function as antigens which induce a humoral immune response, measured by hemagglutination inhibition (HI) antibody).
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This statement directly affirms that Flublok includes the recombinant HA proteins of the exact strains specified by health authorities (such as WHO and FDA) for the annual vaccine, supporting the claim of identical antigenic match.
